message: واحد بيسأل عن أفضل نصائح وخبايا ما تعلمه المبرمجين في حياتهم المهنيه، وأكتر من واحد جاوبوا اجابات حلوه فعلا علي شكل نقاط واضحه وجميله وتستحق القراءة سواء من المبتدئين أو المحترفين.
story: Mohammed El Sayed shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: What are the greatest programming tips and tricks you have learned on your own by years of coding?
caption: quora.com
description: Jerome Terry's answer: I can't really claim I've learned the following lessons on my own. As the famous Newton quote goes "standing on the shoulders of giants". I've learned these lessons by hard work, and reading everything I could get my hands on over the course of the last 17 years - 5 years...

data.message:
"Don't be clever. Don't try to write complicated code on purpose to show how smart you are. Write simple, clear, reusable code. Think Simplicity, Clarity, Generality."

I think this should be plastered on the computer of every new programmer on any team. Or on their face. And particularly for new C programmers, something should auto-punch them every time they use a pointer unnecessarily. In C++ it should threaten their life.

Needed to vent. Thanks for understanding.

you learn the best way to solve a problem , it's not about the language you are using , it's about how to used the language to write efficient code that gives the best results in fastest way , also learn different software applications , components , life cycle of the software engineering and different methodologies to deliver the output to the customer and by mentioning customer , I'd say last is to learn and have experience of how the customer think so you are able to apply customer requirements the way they want not the way u think they do
Learn OO properly, see past the syntax, think in terms of abstractions, learn to make any problem you face a computer science problem and the answers will become apparent very quickly.
